intro: Arabis crantziana, commonly known as the rock白菜 or rock mustard, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its basal rosette of dark green, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in early spring, which are clustered in racemes. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
